website_summaries.verdict: Delivers long-range Bluetooth signal that other transmitters have difficulty matching.
pros: Delivers a Bluetooth signal over 164 ft. for a very high performance level outdoors and up to 70 ft. indoors
Works extremely well as an entertainment hub
Works with both RCA and digital input and output connections
Low latency technology for good performance
cons: Some problems with intermittent connection quality

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for hearing impaired.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding device. Used it to connect my wife's Bose QuietComfort 35 headphones. She has a major hearing problem. In conjunction with her hearing aids, this enables her to completely enjoy the television. Added feature: due to the superior range of the Avantee she can follow the story or music when she leaves the room. It was very easy to install and pair with her headphones. Had it functioning in less than 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: JHG999

customer_reviews.title: would not sync to my Samsung androis phone, called ...
customer_reviews.text: would not sync to my Samsung androis phone,called company 3 times for help,finally 3rd time they picked up.He went through instructions which I did already then said he has to call me back because he has 5 other phone calls and he never called back,what a joke
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really just needed an APPLE TV
customer_reviews.text: Spent over a month trying to use the items made by Avantree. Tech support is impossible. Tech is off shore and their supervisor is in China. Not only the language problem but the time differences were impossible. Tech told me to buy more, I did. Anyway I gave up. Good thing Amazon has a GREAT RETURN POLICY. Turns out all I needed was to purchase an Apple TV. My plasma tv is 8 years old but didn’t have Bluetooth so we could use headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Lebby

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT!-- but only for a few minutes.
customer_reviews.text: little gadget does a lot of things, I would have been happier if only it did any of them well. Set up was easy enough, and it does have voice prompts which I was not expecting, and was a plus. My biggest problem is that I would pair it, start playing music, and a few songs later it would disconnect?!? I would re-pair the connection and again it would work great for a song or two, then disconnect again! I sent it back, and will be buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Moody

customer_reviews.title: GREAT RANGE!!
customer_reviews.text: Simple operation and pairing! Within minutes we had the Avantree Oasis hooked up to our Denon receiver and were able to play music from our phones from anywhere in the house, with no drop-out. To our delight we were even able to play music from phones through our outside speakers from anywhere in the backyard... no drop-out. Very nice to be able to skip tracks and/or change volume while working or playing out back!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Lee

customer_reviews.title: Mine had a weak Audio signal that broke up constantly
customer_reviews.text: Mine was hard to pair with a set of Sennheiser PXC 550 (top of the line) headphones. Then the sound just cracked and dropped in and out. I tried everything assuming it was the TV (Samsung) or the AUX cable (switched to OPT), and even the proximity to other electrical (longer cords)... Nothing worked... it was still breaking up non-stop. Then I bought a different BT Transmitter from another maker (1Mii) and BAM... perfect audio. Maybe mine was a bad one, maybe they're just junk... I dunno. But not worth my effort to return and try to track it down. Buy the more expensive one ($17 instead of $9). Save the 3 hours of troubleshooting
customer_reviews.author: D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: This is a revision to previous review. Was having trouble with my Vizio sound bar fading in and out. Was going to send it back, so just for the heck of it i disconnected the sound bar from the Avantree and connected it directly to the tv.Now the SB works great.Avantree is way to expensive for what it is supposed to do. Wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Topcat

customer_reviews.title: Avantree support is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Avantree support is fantastic. Happy solution reached. Thank you This unit could be the absolute BEST... If if had a removable antenna that would allow an extension cable to be used to move the antenna to a higher location. ORIGINAL Save your money. This only works for about 50 feet. Will not transmit through 1 inside and 1 outside wall. My cheap non long range transmitter works through walls and much farther that this "long range" unit. My other long range BlueTooth transmitter works well beyond 150 feet. The only problem with it is it requires re-powering and re-pairing every time power is lost.
customer_reviews.author: M_

customer_reviews.title: Mine was likely just a bad unit but would not connect or setup
customer_reviews.text: Mine was likely just a bad unit but would not connect or setup. Previous test unit was fine with immediate success, replacement unit was fine with immediate success. I tried this one over days reading and rereading the directions. Not user error. Amazon took it right back and replaced with a different one. It gets enough good reviews that I ordered it and others must have better success so I don't want to dissuade anyone from trying but the unit they sent me wouldn't work when all others did.
customer_reviews.author: We Buy Too Much

customer_reviews.title: Must read Not for any good practical use when you can’t control the transmitter
customer_reviews.text: Stoped working after 2 months. I couldn’t control volume with my wireless ear buds or from the console. I always use and older set of Sound bud slims that are wireless but each ear bud is connected, to control volume. I spent a month out of the country so I missed the return date! No help to resolve!
customer_reviews.author: Swan Dog

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
customer_reviews.text: Piece of chinese junk will not pair with any blue earphones not working at all the Chinese got me agian and buying online
customer_reviews.author: Walt Roberts

customer_reviews.title: After an hour of use, connection start to get intermittent interrupts.
customer_reviews.text: After an hour or so of use, connection starts to get interruptions. I start loosing a word or two in every sentance. This happens when I am 15ft in front of the device with nothing in obstruction. Speaking of obstruction, signals does not seem to travel thru walls well. I would start getting dropped signal if I went to the kitchen from my living room, that is no more than 20 fto away. Forget about going upstairs, no connection at all.
customer_reviews.author: MotoApex

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget
customer_reviews.text: The Avantree long range Bluetooth transmitter and receiver is a really great gadget. I used it to connect my home stereo system to a set of Bose Bluetooth headphones. It paired easily with the headphones, sounded great and gave me easily 50-60 feet of range through walls. I also used it to receive Bluetooth from my iPad to play my music from my iPad to my home stereo. Works great, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: D J L

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend this device.. two BT speaker config
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to set up a BT speaker environment for our TV room at home. I had two high quality BT speakers, but this device required that when the TV would cycle on, the receiver would have to manually be set to send signal to both bluetooth speakers. This device would not keep the last option, meaning each time the TV would come on, i would have to manually set the receiver to transmit to both speakers each time.
customer_reviews.author: Garnie In Texas

customer_reviews.title: When pairing is done, do not change anything and all will work well
customer_reviews.text: Great range, no need to recharge, straightforward instructions how to use, clear indicators to what is happening, ability to control volume. One more tricky part is establishing pairing. I used this transmitter for outdoor Bluetooth speakers. In order to get pairing right, all other Bluetooth devices in the house need to be off! As this transmitter pairs with the closest to it device, and it is not clear what priority is given. At some point I also need to re-pair speakers back and I was only successful after reset transmitter to factory default. So this part is little bit murky, but otherwise it is totally great transmitter!
customer_reviews.author: Arv

customer_reviews.title: Didn't go through clear glass panes but about 20 ft.
customer_reviews.text: Was expecting it to at least go through clear 6ft x 6ft windows. I know they said it would not go through walls, but I thought it would go through clear glass panes. I mean it does, but only for about 20 ft, that's it! I'm using it on a new Samsung note, so no excuse to not go very far. I do like the voice telling you it's connected and it was simple to connect to bluetooth. Oh well, I'll keep searching for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Houston

customer_reviews.title: Low fidelity, not long range.
customer_reviews.text: Long range my ***! I purchased this device for the specific purpose of wirelessly sending music from the desktop computer in my study to the stereo system in my basement shop, a total distance of 30 feet. For a transmitter with a claimed "proven range of 295 feet", this distance didn't seem to much to ask. But in my case 30 feet was clearly at the maximum range of this so called "long range transmitter". At 30 feet my music sounded hollow and tinny (think old school AM transistor radio), and there were frequent annoying signal drops. If you actually care about how your music sounds then this Bluetooth transmitter is not what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Landin

customer_reviews.title: Great bluetooth transmitter: connector issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT long-range bluetooth transmitter, which I use to go to my Anker Sound Buds Life that I wear to allow sound boost for me alone, while others in the room use the speakers driven by the TV set at a lower sound level. My only issue: the product description led me to assume the Avantree could be fed sound directly from two cables with RCA jacks. In fact, it has only a 3.5mm jack and is only supplied with a 3.5mm to RCA adapter cable that has female connectors, whereas male are needed. Luckily, I had a usable cable in by junk box.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard of WID

customer_reviews.title: CHOOSE A BETTER BRAND... WASTE OF MONEY AND FRUSTRATING SET UP
customer_reviews.text: Returning... not at all easy to set up and connect... had to call the company for help to set it up... ONE person is all they have for help desk! This woman can barely speak English and is not at all helpful... everything is “I will email you in the next 24 hours”... I finally called Samsung, which is my tv... they have a much better handle on this product than Avantree has... Samsung had it working within 15 minutes... Be aware that there is no volume control if you’re lucky enough to get it working at all.
customer_reviews.author: Angela S. Ando

customer_reviews.title: Good but not enough!
customer_reviews.text: Now I can hear my TV from the chair using my Bose earplugs without disturbing anybody. The sound quality is okay but it could be better. Some times the earplugs lost instantaneous connection, some times only one of the earplugs. I have the TV really close so I don't know how the connectivity could be lost if I move further away. So, so far so good. *UPDATE* Unfortunately the transmiter didn't pass the test. I have my TV less than three feets away and I had a lot of disconnection events with my Bose earbuds every time I move around the room and was really hard to reconnected them. So I had to returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Bran

customer_reviews.title: mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I was going to return because I was having so many issues pairing to my new Douni A5 speaker. On my second day attempt, it paired. I tested at my office the range. Using just the Bluetooth on the speaker I could get about 30' and one concrete wall. With the transmitter, I got about 60' and 4 walls between the speaker and transmitter with no break-up. So I am more hopeful. 3 stars due to the fact they only ship a USB cord to plug into a device for power, no wall plug. Also, the instructions are limited and do not provide instruction on how to cancel a Bluetooth connection. Had to google it.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. G.

customer_reviews.title: Works but not as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Ok so this unit works but not as advertised. Doesn't even receive the signal from 15 feet away without walls. I keep hearing static noise and occasional sound cut off. I decided to buy Avantree Oasis Long Range Bluetooth to keep playing music out of phone inside the house while I'm away from the Bluetooth receiver. I have another receiver that is not long range and was less than $20. This unit didn't do what I wanted to do so bought Avantree Oasis but Avantree Oasis offers exactly the same range or WORSE with a lot more STATIC NOISE and CUT OFFs. Terrible item and not worth for the price.
customer_reviews.author: KZ

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't transmit properly, linking difficult.
customer_reviews.text: Connected to two different devices. Even with the volume turned all the way up I could barely hear the audio on either devise. Looking at Avantree's website they know they have a problem put instead of fixing it themselves they choose to turn it into an inconvenience for the consumer. Note to Avantree, if your device doesn't work as advertised I'm not going to troubleshoot it, I'm going to send it back. I paid for a properly working device. I also found linking the device somewhat non-intuitive. With modern technology this should be at least an extremely simple procedure if not completely automatic.
customer_reviews.author: Tim B, Business Owner

customer_reviews.title: Significant echo with Avantree BTHT-3189 headphones
customer_reviews.text: Significant echo! Bought this transmitter to use with a TV in another room. But it senses the Avantree BTHT-3189 headphones as utilizing SBC codec so there is significant echo. In short, 60 day old headphones are useless with this Avantree transmitter due to the audio delay. I am returning this Avantree Oasis transmitter. I would return the existing one along with headphones as well but am beyond the 30 day return window. I am astounded that a manufacture would sell such incompatible devices.
customer_reviews.author: KeysBill

customer_reviews.title: Finally, BT Transmitter that Works
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered about 6 different brands of BT transmitter. I have returned them all for one reason or another. Difficult to pair. Impossible to pair with 2 headsets, poor sound, terrible mis-sync of sound and video, to name a few. This one is really well designed. Pairs instantly with last paired headset, is easy to sync with 2 sets at once, good sound, easy to hook up. The only thing slightly less than perfect is that there is a very small delay between sound and video, but it is small enough that I have gotten used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Silberman

customer_reviews.title: I Like it but I do have some issues with it.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well I sometimes have to try to connect a few times before it picks up my headphones.I however this may be a Powerbeats issue but not sure. Also there are times when the sound cuts in and out Almost like a heartbeat. But it works perfectly fine 75% of the time. It’s can be little annoying when that happens but I would still recommended It to any of my friends. One thing I would have liked is Ability to turn off the announcement it makes every time it power on. It’s pretty loud and will disturb someone if they are sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Albert F.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the coinage
customer_reviews.text: I bought another one after falling in love with this one. First one I bought was for the bedroom TV (wifey catches zzz's earlier than me). I bought it for the volume control where the previous I bought (claimed you could use for volume control) failed. Have truly tested distance but I'll walk around the house and never have break up. Second was for the living room TV. Equally great but.... If you pair to the same headphones they battle for dominance!!!! Simply just turn one off to remedy 😁. Totally recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: lambflirta

customer_reviews.title: This was a great Bluetooth transmitter.
customer_reviews.text: Update 1-7-2020: I've had this for about a year and a half now and recently they started losing connection. The sound just drops out randomly after about 5 minutes of use and keeps cutting in and out. No longer usable. Original Review: This is a great Bluetooth transmitter. I pair it up with: and can listen to my TV and stereo throughout the house with no loss of connection.
customer_reviews.author: Pyles The Beaver

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but....
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased one of these transmitters a couple of years ago and it worked great. I recently ordered another one and frustratingly it came with a broken power cord (Amazon should do a better job of checking their returns before reselling them.) Additionally, it interferes with the first one I bought. We have kept them far apart from each other, but that isn't helping. When you have both of them on and in different rooms across the house they still connect to the first speaker that was turned on. It is annoying. I wish there was a way to make this stop.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy With These (but they are not perfect)
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. One is transmitter and the other is receiver. They talk to each other from across the house. I am streaming music from my computer to my stereo. It works great for that. No drops at all in sound quality (using optical cable). As mentioned these are not perfect. I don't like the little slider to switch from bluetooth to bypass. I use it a lot. Its way too small and it feels flimsy. I know its going to break eventually. (A button on the screen like everything else what have been better choice.). It would also be cool if they had the option to send signal to both bluetooth and bypass at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this today and had it all going in 15 minutes. Exceeds my expectations. I have the unit placed and connected to my audio equipment on the third floor of my house and am transmitting from my hot tub which I am guessing is close to 150' away if not further (see photos). So far no complaints. This is GREAT because every time I used to go into the hot tub I had to run between the hot tub and the house in an attempt to get the sound I wanted. Since my Smartphone has my music app (PowerAmp) and has a built in Equalizer now I can do it right from the hot tub! Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Charge

customer_reviews.title: Will not pair with Blaupunkt Stereo Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Some devices such as my Blaupunkt stereo receiver, require the transmitter to find them and initiate pairing. This Avantree device is not compatible with that type of device. It probably works fine with devices where the receiver has a pairing button, but will definitely not work with devices that use "passive pairing". If you want to pair with a "passive pairing" device, the Avantree will not work. I wish they had been more clear about that in their product description.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the hype in the ad. Don't buy this item. I'm sorry I did. You will too.
customer_reviews.text: Manufacturer claims, "Experience the wireless freedom to walk anywhere in the house! Proven range of 295ft in testing with headphones." I fell for this bull-loney hook, line, and sinker. After having this "product" a little over a week, it's weak. I'm guessing when Avantree got that 295 ft of distance, it must have been accomplished using 295 ft of hard wire instead of Bluetooth. Paired with my Skull Candy Crusher headphones, I cannot go into the next room without it quitting on me. The built-in Bluetooth in my HP computer is more powerful than this piece of junk. I can only use my headphones in the same room with the Avantree Oasis nearby. I am VERY disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Shoe String Studio

customer_reviews.title: Optical TV Hook-up Option on Avantree Oasis
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Oasis (BTTC-500) Bluetooth (BT) transmitter/receiver in order to create a wireless method of listening to my TV without disturbing the rest of the household. Due to TV output problems, I was unable to use the AUX connection; however, the customer support team at Avantree provided exceptional support and walked me through the setup process for the optical connection between my TV and the Oasis. The optical connectivity is outstanding. It provides crystal clear sound without hiss or background noise that might be found on other Bluetooth devices. I would highly recommend this product. Its clarity and transmission range are exceptional.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great luck with all of my Avantree products!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 9/22/17. Great for TV and other electronics. My laptop doesn't have blue tooth. Plugged this into audio jack and paired my Avantree Bluetooth headphones ( and could walk all over home listening to my Amazon Prime Music. My boyfriend had on a different pair of Avantree headphones {bought 7/28/16} ( and listening to TV (Priva II bought 7/12/16  and I could walk past him and neither one of us had any interference.
customer_reviews.author: pta50

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to find a device which would allow a Bluetooth connection to a speaker but also allow the broadcast device to leave the sound on. EG: Watching TV and having the sound over a remote speaker. But, when you connect the wires to the TV it cuts the sound out. We like to listen to Sirius on the TV and I wanted to listen on a remote speaker. Other than that, the device work very well.
customer_reviews.author: NaplesJoe

customer_reviews.title: The Best Bluetooth Addition to Your Devices
customer_reviews.text: You will not be disappointed with including this Bluetooth device in your media/technical system. The Avamtree Oasis has all of the inputs and outputs that you will need to Bluetooth enable your system. What you need to know is the cables that are included are very short so please be prepared to provide longer cables. The other thing you need to know is that you may need unique cables to fit your particular situation. Do not assume that all of the cables are provided for your particular system. We were able to add Bluetooth to our LG UHD Smart LED TV and the results were amazing. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Lowell A. Isenberg

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth Transmitter/Receiver Well Done!
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth Transmitter is what I was looking for to be able to use my Bluetooth headphones. My amplifier, a Yamaha, had only Bluetooth receiving capability...not transmitting. The set up is easy, although my hookup to the Yamaha required banana plugs so I bought a banana/RCA plug setup to complete the connection. The system comes with good hookup plugs for most amps. Quality product and great customer service. The system also can be a receiver if you want to port your iPhone/iPad Blurtooth to your amp. Well priced to be affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce M. Daniell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Company!
customer_reviews.text: The video was very helpful. I used this product to connect my xbox one to my bose wireless bluetooth headphones. It works, but frequently it cuts out. I find when it starts to cut out it is best to reset the unit, and headphones. I mainly am disappointed with Microsoft though. Really microsoft, no bluetooth headset support? Not impressed. Update! They contacted me about my cutting in and out issue. Sent me a new updated unit that works fine. Apparently there is a firmware update that helps tremendously if you are having problems this company will help you out!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Richards

customer_reviews.title: Crackling sounds off and on?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to run my TV sounds to my Bluetooth speakers that do not have a volume control on them so I hooked it up through the 3.5 mm auxiliary jacks and it would work for a short time and then Crackle Non-Stop from only at most 30 ft away from the speakers so I do not know why it would not go that distance when it says it's good for a much longer distance? I couldn't get it to stop so I disconnected it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Bluetooth Transmitter Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Simple to connect TV and one set of headphones. Additional headphones depends on the type. The better your set of headphones, the better it works for connecting two at one time. Auto connect works unless you have been connected to another bluetooth item like your cellphone or car, then you may have to reconnect. Otherwise, sound quality and distance that it operates are above and beyond. I would recommend as not alot of quality ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Works with my hearing aids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add to an older bedroom tv that isn't "smart". I use and amazon fire stick for streaming. I plugged this device into the tv and pair it with my blue tooth capable hearing aids and now I can listen to the TV right in my ears. I don't know if this is a pro or con to others--pro to me--sound does not come out of the tv speakers when using this. Only con is that I have to specifically pair my hearing aids everytime I use it. Small price to pay. First world problems.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pair
customer_reviews.text: Range is close to what they claim. Latency is not however. There is a noticeable delay. Easy to pair. Edit: Turns out the receiver is listed as aptX but is not. Works nicely now. Avantree has awsome customer serviice. I have tested a little more. My Bluedio headphones have good reception at 130 ft. Not sure how much further range I can get as I never got out of range.
customer_reviews.author: Tom L.

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good product
customer_reviews.text: It has skimpy instructions requiring some trail and error. It gets confused if there are several strong bluetooth devices around. The range is fair although the remote is limited. It likes to reinitialize. I have used it with a TV for using headphones and an older receiver/tuner. This one died from an electrical surge, which is a problem in this engineers opinion. I will buy another but will get the next better model. Overall its a good value, just be prepared to spend some time getting acquainted.
customer_reviews.author: James Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Bypass Mode RULES!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought several other models and returned them all. I was looking for a device that would support my external sound bar when I wasn't using headphones. This device has a switch that allows you to place it in "bypass" mode. I had another Bluetooth transmitter that I used in the past, but I had to use a SPDIF/Toslink splitter in order to keep my sound bar connected. I also needed to use an optical to copper converter. Now that I'm using this Avantree Oasis, I was able to remove two devices from the wire nest behind my TV. The fact that it's USB powered is great! One less power outlet used on my surge protector/power strip.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff and Charity

customer_reviews.title: Got sleeping kids, but still want to watch movies? You need this!!!
customer_reviews.text: My tv sits right at the bottom of my stairs, so watching tv after the kids go to bed can be a challenge. Problem solved!!! This connects to the tv easily and pairing with my headphones is not too difficult. I have a pair of Bose QC headphones, and I do notice just the tiniest bit of speech lag (lips not quite in sync with sound) but it really is barely noticeable and doesn’t distract from watching. My only issue is the volume control. When it’s up loud enough for good sound over Bluetooth, the voice prompts from the transmitter is LOUD!! But overall, it’s a great device.
customer_reviews.author: SLW

customer_reviews.title: Works well.  Had trouble with Bose speakers.
customer_reviews.text: This is a difficult item to review because the goal of listening music to or from another device means that the other device may be at fault. However, I had been trying to setup something using either my turntable/stereo or Bose bluetooth speakers. Using the Bose speakers was frequently an issue due to having to get them linked. I suspect that any trouble I had was on the Bose side but I really can't say with absolute certainty. But I do know that I didn't have trouble linking to my iPhone or my Apple earbuds when using the Oasis. I would say that I wish the cords that come with the Oasis were just a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: JMR

customer_reviews.title: Much better second time around!
customer_reviews.text: I have evaluated a replacement unit (Thank You Avantree) and posting four stars instead of one. This device will pair with two headphones and works in a transmit or receive mode (utilizing Bluetooth). This turns out to be a well made device and customer support is great (one of the reasons I changed my evaluation to four stars). I take one star away for what I feel is a missing feature: The unit should provide Optical input to AUX output (and maybe even AUX to Optical) as a default and only Optical to Optical and AUX to AUX in bypass mode.
customer_reviews.author: Drummer Boy

customer_reviews.title: AirPod Connection
customer_reviews.text: Received this transmitter today (on a Sunday!) Need a good AirPod connection. Pushed the buttons on both devices and had successful connection in just a few seconds. Worked so much better than some of the cheap devices I have. Since AirPods have no volume control, I'm just sending output from main amp through a secondary amp (one of my oldies) to adjust the volume. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: NunnCo

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Easy Setup -- Great Audio
customer_reviews.text: The Oasis unit required less than 10 minutes to set up (and that included unpacking the unit and reading the directions). It was literally plug-and-play. The quality has been excellent with extremely little audio lag. I used this unit to send audio from my PC via Bluetooth to my home stereo system. The instructions are clear and after placing the unit in "receive" mode and turning on the power it immediately went into paring mode. My Windows 10 PC connected in seconds. Audio is CD-quality. Overall, I'm very impressed with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using the same speaker and music source (a stereo amplifier/receiver) the Avantree produced a wonderful sound on my wireless spe
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing the Avantree Oasis, I had tried using another brand, somewhat less expensive, but not by much. The other brand was a disaster with a distorted sound, so I returned it. Using the same speaker and music source (a stereo amplifier/receiver) the Avantree produced a wonderful sound on my wireless speaker. I am most pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Cristóbol

customer_reviews.title: Solid option but audio quality is lacking
customer_reviews.text: The good thing about this product is it works well and is one of the few APTX Low Latency transmitters on the market. I tested it with Avantree APT-LL headphones and the range covered my entire apartment with ease. One thing I will say is that the audio sounded tinny and I was never able to get the passthrough audio feature to work. All in all good product though I returned mine because it wasn't quite what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: J&GI

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It talks! I did not know it would do that when I purchased, but its actually great having audio feedback confirming what settings are set. Purchased because we have two TVs in the same room, one for TV, one for Xbox. Other person watching TV can now watch TV with bluetooth headphones and not listen to me talking to people on my headset for Xbox. Automatically detects when my sound bar and TV turns on, and immediately turns on. Transitioning between bypass and Bluetooth is easy, just a switch on the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Airpods
customer_reviews.text: Been using for a few weeks now. Setup was a little frustrating, but mainly because I was to lazy to read the (included and detailed) directions. After fiddling around with the connection’s and various button combinations for about thirty minutes, a reliable connection was established with my TV for watching Netflix and other streaming content using Apple AirPods. This setup is used in my workout area, and after returning on numerous cycles to start a new session, the system connects very fast and automatically when turning the Bluetooth switch back on. The voice prompt’s work well and tells you when it connects. Seems to be a quality product, and very reliable so far. Very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nightflyer

customer_reviews.title: Simple to set up
customer_reviews.text: Set up was extremely simple it took me about five minutes to get up and running. I was looking for a way do you use headphones at night so my wife could get to sleep without listening to me blasting the TV. I just switched from dishnet who had Bluetooth connection but one that did not work with my Bose quiet comfort 35s to DIRECTV who had no Bluetooth connection to headphones at all. I see a couple folks having connecting problems but I have had zero. It connected quickly it is stable I can walk All throughout my house and even and step outside on my deck without losing connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I totally recommend this device.. it was easy to connect to non-smart TV, and the sound quality was great. I wish that it came with its own power cord however it wasn't a big deal. Unfortunately, I had to send it back because, I thought my old bose 321 system was dying on me. The wires were just loose. Lol. Anyway if you have a old TV, this is the way to go. 👍🏾
customer_reviews.author: Stormy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding little Bluetooth unit. Works well, well made.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Connected to the Avantree transmitter puck and used this as receiver and they paired in about 15 sec and were running in no time. Seems well made, glad I read other reviews to decide on this one. Used about 50 feet apart through bough a concrete basement wall and drywall without any issue and ZERO delay from projector to sound. Probably could have gotten a few nickels cheaper but this had great reviews and descriptions compared to mediocre others....there’s a reason for that. It’s a great unit. Haven’t tried it in tx mode cuz my other unit does the tx part.
customer_reviews.author: klw

customer_reviews.title: Easy 10 minute setup.
customer_reviews.text: I used this so I could have bluetooth ear buds to listen to tv at night without disturbing my neighbors when I crank up the sound. My 2016 tv did not have bluetooth connectivity. This totally fixed that issue. I couldn't be happier. I literally had it set up and done in 10 minutes. I was surprised because I'm so not a techy person.
customer_reviews.author: mcpopp

customer_reviews.title: WOW. Give it 10 stars!
customer_reviews.text: What a pleasure. Out of the box this exceeded every expectation. Does what I hoped for and more. After trying other BT transmitters with great disappointment, this is the first to cut through two walls and deliver a strong, quality signal from the computer in my den to the BT speaker in my shower. It's fantastic and I recommend it (without incentive) whole-heartedly. Easy to set up. Easy to use. Brilliant quality in build and signal delivery. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Armato

customer_reviews.title: Simple to set up and connect.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to broadcast music from my analog receiver to a new pair of Bluetooth outdoor speakers. It works flawlessly. The signal penetrates a brick wall and a glass sliding door to reach the speakers over a distance of about 20 feet. I haven't tried to see how far the range would actually be effective, as I have no need to extend beyond my setup, but I'm totally happy with the signal strength and simple connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Action Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I am able to hear the feedback sound, like when I click a button, but no sound from Youtube or any app. Could very well be the problem of the TV. I am giving 5 stars because I am sure, this item does not have a problem, but would like to get this across that if you have this TV that I have, it wont work. My model is UN60KU6270FXZA. Works like a champ on two bluetooths.
customer_reviews.author: Aquaremo

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth range is extremely disappointing, my laptop bluetooth works just as well. Continual dropouts at 15 feet through a frame wall. Will most likely return, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Cygnus

customer_reviews.title: NOT long range and with quality problems
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these, one for home and one for the boat. The house unit started to loose connection and quality when in receiving mode, paired to my iPhone X and I walked 20 feet away (no walls in-between). The one on my boat works as I can't get that far from mid cabin where the unit is located. I just replaced the house unit wih the1Mii B03 Long Range Bluetooth 4.2 Transmitter Receiver. This new unit works with great sound wherever I walk in my house. Don't waste your money on Avantree.
customer_reviews.author: John Galt

customer_reviews.title: No power adapter, low volume level and ultra short cables.
customer_reviews.text: Could not beleive that this unit did not ship with an AC power adapter. While they include a micro USB cable, no USB power cube was included. Unacceptable for a device that sells for $50. In addition, the output volume level is so low it requires you to overdrive your amplifier to get a listenable volume level. Finally, the cables included are far too short to connect to anything. No way this should be rated this high. It's going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer_66

customer_reviews.title: but it is a lot better thought out than other dual mode transmitters
customer_reviews.text: Works well will my Bose QC35 for watching TV via optical audio. It's had a few rare hiccups that were resolved by turning the unit from transmitting mode to receiving and back again, or clearing the paired devices history. More a fault of the Bluetooth technology than the Oasis. It's slightly overpriced for what it is, but it is a lot better thought out than other dual mode transmitters, which mostly look and function like something you would find at Ross/Marshalls.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This works great and the distance is fantastic. I paired it with Bluetooth 4.0 ear buds and leave it in the house. Then I go outside and mow the lawn. Even through walls I didn't experience any drops. I estimate the distance to be around at least 50ft since my Electric mower extension cord is 100 ft. I am very happy with this product. Note: If you pair it with Bluetooth 3.0 or less the distance will not be the same. I tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: A long-range bluetooth transmitter that lives up to its name
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY - an advertised LONG RANGE bluetooth transmitter that works! I've had one heck of a time finding a bluetooth transmitter with enough range to transmit from our outdoor TV across the patio to our hot tub (only about 15 feet away). I've gone through about 4-5 different transmitters, most claiming to be long-range but none actually worked. This thing is easy to work with - it even includes voice prompts "power on - reconnecting to your last device" and "connection successful" and even "could not connect. Try pairing again, or to pair a new device, do XYZ." 5 out of 5 - would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good range
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my home gym to broadcast from the TV to my bluetooth headphones, for which purpose it works quite well. It also has enough range that I can wear the headphones while washing the car in the driveway and stream music from the TV. That's about 75 feet away from the transmitter through a sheetrock wall and a brick wall.
customer_reviews.author: ApathyCurve

customer_reviews.title: Good product for headsets but not Bluetooth speakers.
customer_reviews.text: This may be a good product but it would not do what I wanted to do. It paired to my sound bar just fine. When I tried to pair my ear buds to it along with the sound bar, it would indicate that both were paired but there would be intermittent sound. When I paired two sets of earbuds to it, it worked great. I have returned it not because it is a bad product but it doesn’t suit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Cockrell

customer_reviews.title: My Samsung phone and watch have a longer transmit range than this does
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for both the transmitter and receiver. The instructions do say the range is reduced when using earbuds but I think a range of only 5-8 feet is a bit short. My Samsung phone provides a range of at least 100 feet and my Samsung watch gives me 25. Receiver is good so I will keep it and look for a better transmitter.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kent

customer_reviews.title: We are using this in a massage clinic setting, works well through a wall.
customer_reviews.text: We are using this to play iTunes library from PC to some Bose (Soundlink III) bluetooth speakers. Works great and was easy to set up. The Avantree is plugged into the computer (on transmitter mode), the speakers get paired to the transmitter, and that's it -- press play! Speakers have stayed connected since set-up a few weeks ago! Only thing to note is a sound delay on active speaker when one of the speakers is powered off (1-star docked). We wish it could pair a 3rd speaker, but the max is 2... Distance of furthest speaker is ~20 feet away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this!  I wish I found it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for this technology and didn't know it existed! Now, I'm able to connect to my computer and TV via bluetooth and not be tethered to a wire... I can walk around the house and multitask while listening. I only with the range was higher. If I walk to the opposite side of the house or the garage, I loose connection. Otherwise, this is exactly what I've been looking for. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Avantree Products
customer_reviews.text: This is our latest purchase from Avantree, the Oasis. Prior to this purchase I was using Avantree aptX LOW LATENCY transmitter, in the family room. I am an early morning riser. I record my shows and watch in the morning without disturbing my children/grand kids. My other review of Avantree Headphones What else can I say I own 5 of these headphones, 3 are paired to Avantree aptX LOW LATENCY Bluetooth Transmitter and Receiver and the other 2 are paired to my grandchildren laptops. Battery life is very good I get about 6 hours before mine starts to beep. Overall I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Hearing Impaired Using An Oticon Streamer Pro
customer_reviews.text: I use this to listen to streaming pod casts from a laptop as I work around the house. Since I have a "Profound" hearing loss, I link this to my Oticon Streamer Pro and it sends the audio right into my hearing aids. Be aware that if you want' to use it with your TV, the TV must have aptX low-latency audio capability or there will be a lip-sync delay. The maker stands by their warranty and has terrific customer support. You can't go wrong buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: LARRY ROBERT JONES

customer_reviews.title: This works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: I got this so I could listen to my basement shop TV while I'm running loud equipment. I put on some bluetooth ear buds under my ear muffs and can hear the TV fine. It is also useful for those shows dialog get really low and hard to hear if there is background noise. There is a slight latency delay. So if I have the earbuds in I usually mute the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Travis R

customer_reviews.title: With an unblocked open line-of site setting (no walls = nothing in between) the greatest distance I could still get it to work was ...
customer_reviews.text: "Long range" is greatly overstated including the stated distance. With an unblocked open line-of site setting (no walls = nothing in between) the greatest distance I could still get it to work was 30 maybe 35 feet (just over 10 m). That is not enough of a distance to say it was worthwhile to get it, since I have cables that long.
customer_reviews.author: tworighthands

customer_reviews.title: Volume too low
customer_reviews.text: I hook this unit to my TV/Cable/Blueray and use my LG HBS912 headset and have tried others as well. I use this to try and hear the tv better. The volume that this transmitter emits is way too low, I can not hear well enough. The headset volume when streaming music or video from other bluetooth devices such as my phone, computer or other devices is very loud, so it's not the headsets.
customer_reviews.author: The Capy

customer_reviews.title: High quality electronics
customer_reviews.text: This one is more money then the other ones but it works really good. There is no audio lag whatsoever unlike the cheap $20 ones. Plus this thing talks to you and tells you it's connected instead of just blinking lights. I have my headphones connected and it has a bypass mode to switch to your speaker. It works flawlessly which is perfect for me. Nothing worse when you just want to kick back but have to try to get everything to work properly first. Well done avantree
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Works, but you get what you pay for?
customer_reviews.text: The connection has a background “hiss”. I’ve tried different volume controls both with the Unit and the the TV and can’t seem to get rid of it. I know it’s not the ear buds as they connect to my phone and perform perfectly Odd too was that my Sony buds wouldn’t connect, yet a cheaper pair does
customer_reviews.author: Russell Reiber

customer_reviews.title: It seems like a good device
customer_reviews.text: This device worked initially. It powered right on, connected with our Bluetooth speakers and would accept input signal from our phones. However, it would not accept input signal from our TV which is why we bought it to begin with. Nothing we tried would make it accept & transmit the audio output from our surround receiver, so we returned it. It seems like a good device, the sellers were very anxious to reach out to us sending us 2 exploratory emails, and we received a refund quickly so that's all very good. But it did not work for our purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R. Kluth

customer_reviews.title: Convenient to use product
customer_reviews.text: I am using this product in the TX mode . Have not tried the other features. It has visual indicators and also voice alerts. I connected it to a wall-power USB source and did not have to touch it thereafter. I use the AUX connection to get audio. Typically my range is about 20 ft. If I go into another room which has obstacles such as refrigerators it gets un paired. As I said I like it because of the convenience. I have other units that cost below $30 but are less convenient. George
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Elderly lady loves Jeopardy! again.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for an older women who has difficulty hearing and following subtitles on her television. Paired the product w/bluetooth earbuds (be sure to disconnect headphones from any other device they may be attached to, i.e. laptop.) I'm am no whiz on these matters, however the entire set-up procedure came in at fewer than ten minutes. Vendor documentation is lay-accessible. Website is also a valuable resource. Bottom line, she's back to shouting out those Jeopardy! questions. Highly recommended product for those in similar situations.
customer_reviews.author: dartvard

customer_reviews.title: Blue tooth now working
customer_reviews.text: So I got a cheap one with a battery in it. Something stopped charging. So I got this one. Well looks like it as a bad cable. Nice thing is this one is supposed to be much longer range. ZERO battery to charge which is nice and it can support 2 headsets. Also, it has the dual-mode that I probably won't use but I can see possibilities having it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Owen

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my AV receiver!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other bluetooth transmitters and this one finally seems to be a home run. I had been wanting a solution that would work with my Pioneer AV receiver and my wife's Beats headphones. The optical ports are perfect for this and allows me to get high quality sound and to use the optical input and outputs on my receiver. The range also seems to be good, which as lacking in my TV's and DVR's bluetooth. Installation was fast (about 10 min if you are familiar with your receiver's ports) and pairing went very well for 2x headphones.
customer_reviews.author: dalec

customer_reviews.title: the sound quality transmitted or received from device is very good. No questions on the range as I had ...
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly, the sound quality transmitted or received from device is very good. No questions on the range as I had no dead spots around the house unlike my other Bluetooth device where their signals fade just by going from one room to the other. I used this as a transmitter to my JBL Charge 3 and Extreme. I was having problem on the Charge 3 -the signal is cutoff from time to time while the Extreme is solid. I think I got this problem on the Charge 3 after I updated its firmware. Overall, I like this product for it's sound quality, low latency and really loooong range!
customer_reviews.author: papaque

customer_reviews.title: VOICE FAILED IN TWO MONTHS. DON'T BUY IF YOU WANT THE VOICE FUNCTION.
customer_reviews.text: OK UNTIL THE VOICE STOPPED WORKING. Was working fine until the VOICE WENT TOTALLY SILENT on March 18th. Other transmitter functions, including paring, still work. BUT THERE IS NO VOICE ANYMORE FOR ANY FUNCTIONS. So the voice lasted ONLY 2 MONTHS. Am using it in TX mode only.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Beggs

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I turn on my Blue Tooth headphones, turn on my Roku TV and this wonderful voice on the Avantree Oasis tells me it is "pairing" with last paired device. No muss, no fuss. Previously with a different Blue Tooth device I lost reception frequently. So far reception has been better than I had hoped for. Satisfied? Most definitely. I hope it continues to serve my needs in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, works well. No noticeable latency when in LL mode.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using two of these; one in TX mode connected to TV optical output and a second in RX mode connected to powered speakers. They paired easily, stay paired, re-pair immediately if powered down. Latency is not noticeable, and I'm also using the TVs internal speakers so I think it would be apparent if there was latency when used in this manner. Don't know if distance claims are accurate; I'm using with only about 15 meters separating TX and RX units. Small, unobtrusive and controls are logical and intuitive. Just set and forget. Other than that, they work as well and sound identical as wired speakers but without wires.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Works great with BT speakers and such.
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I have it connected to my TV across the room and use a bluetooth personal speaker at my side to be able to hear dialog that I couldn't seem to hear well before. I also have a BT karaoke speaker that works even better when I want to hear the soundtrack of a movie. I am now thinking about getting rid of my sound system on the TV since this arrangement pretty much makes it obsolete. The sound system was not that great so no big loss in hard dollars.
customer_reviews.author: TimH

customer_reviews.title: Bowler300
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the Power On/Off voice notification. It’s so loud and I haven’t figured out how to turn it off yet. Supposedly there is a way but the instructions is so unclear. Also when the originating sound source is turned off, the Avantree sounds off that it is connector last known Bluetooth device. Waits a few minutes before auto turn off of power.
customer_reviews.author: Bowler300

customer_reviews.title: Volume Control
customer_reviews.text: This transmitter works pretty good with my receiver to the wireless bluetooth outdoor speakers I have. It has a good range and the volume control on the unit is what you need if your speakers do not have volume buttons. You will need to ask for a unit without volume restriction, if you want to listen to speakers loudly. The first unit I received had a restriction and I believe was geared more towards headphones, so you don't bust your ear drums. Customer service from Avantree was great though and sent me the non restricted unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Give it a try!
customer_reviews.text: Only had the product for three days however the TV Bluetooth works very well, I haven't figured out how to alternate between my PC and Avantree Bluetooth using Aux plug? Will keep experimenting! OOPS I figured it out and now trying to figure out how to opt from one TV source to another....The Device is in fact long range and very clear!
customer_reviews.author: Steven McKim

customer_reviews.title: Good product.  Will not go through a stone wall.
customer_reviews.text: We use this every day to connect our TV in the living room to our wireless speaker in the kitchen to listen to the evening news. Straight line, maybe 30 feet. The issue is the 16 inch stone wall in between. It will not transmit through or around the wall. We had a long audio cord that allowed us to relocate the transmitter to the other side of the wall which solved the problem although not ideal. It is reliable and easy to use. It clearly transmits better that those advertised for 20 to 30 feet range.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: This device works except it does not auto-reconnect
customer_reviews.text: In general, this device works for most people. it has good sound quality and fast connect, but It does not work for me. I find that the device does NOT automatically re-connect to my bluetooth headset. most bluetooth device automatically reconnect the their pairing, this one does not, I am not sure why and it is cumbersome. It requires that you press the bluetooth button to reconnect. The voice prompt is loud and annoying. There are no option to softer the volume and turn off voice prompt. I am returning this (thanks Amazon) and look for a device that auto re-connect just like most bluetooth devices do and WITHOUT voice prompt.
customer_reviews.author: subcoco

customer_reviews.title: Great Blue Tooth Product
customer_reviews.text: Does even better than I expected. Transmits farther than I need and sound is instant, no lag in the lips moving and sound following. It also plugs into the USB port on the Screen for power and it is not on all the time. If it was plugged into a continuously live outlet, it would ware out faster and bothersome trying to sleep with the lights on. I highly recommend it. Pat
customer_reviews.author: pat roberts

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Samsung Smart TV and low latency bluetooth headphones
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my 900MHz TV -> headphone system. The Avantree Bluetooth has good reviews. Add mine to them. It works as advertised and very well when connected to the audio out on a Samsung Smart TV, then on to regular Bluetooth headphones. If the TV sound is "up" (others in room listening) these is a noticeable delay which was noted in the product description. If the sound is muted all is well. So, I bought low-latency headphones. Now, all is in sync. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D

customer_reviews.title: Good long range Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: My wife likes to listen to her computer with wireless headphones while doing other chores. The transmitter we have failed soon after leaving the room where we keep the computer. This Avantree Oasis Long Range Bluetooth Transmitter Receiver works well all over the house and even in the front and back yards. I believe the stated range claims are correct. Very pleased and recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A Linux User

customer_reviews.title: Good product; easy to use; great range
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, even when placed in a high density RF area (for example, mine is one foot away from a WiFi hot spot). Took me literaly 20 seconds to set this up. Very easy. Make sure you read the sticker that comes attached to it. Literature is written in proper English and easy to understand. Satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Solar_Ize

customer_reviews.title: Weaker volume than expected
customer_reviews.text: So far, this unit has been a bit of a disappointment. After first purchasing the Esuper receiver/transmitter, I decided to "upgrade" to the Avantree Oasis for longer range transmission and low latency features. Unfortunately, I have found the little Esuper to be superior in some ways to the Oasis! The audio volume is significantly greater on the smaller, cheaper unit as compared to the more expensive, non-portable Oasis. I am considering returning the Oasis because volume is a primary concern.
customer_reviews.author: cassie whiting

customer_reviews.title: easy setup no lag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for listening to TV while indoor cycling for hours. The setup was really simple as the voice lets you know when you BT headset is connected which is nice. It works great when close to it which is my use case as I'm usually around 10 ft from the device. I did go up to the next floor directly above where the device is and it was breaking up a bit which I don't have a need for that use case. All in all for the cost it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: J Mo Scit

product_meta.title: Avantree Oasis Long Range Bluetooth Transmitter Receiver for TV & PC, aptX Low Latency Wireless Audio Adapter for Headphones, Home Stereo, Dual Link, Voice Guide, Touch Screen, Optical AUX RCA
feature_bullets: [Extended Long Range] Experience wireless freedom to walk anywhere in the house! Proven range of 295ft in testing with headphones (audition Pro), and 328ft using Oasis as a Transmitter, RC500 as a receiver Pair in open air line-of-sight conditions. Note that operating range can be affected by multiple factors.

[No Lip-sync Delay] Supports the aptX Low Latency codec to virtually eliminate audio-visual lag making the Oasis an ideal choice for watching TV / movies. For best results, use with aptX Low Latency supporting headphones / speakers, like the Avantree Audition Pro and Torpedo Plus. As a receiver, doesn't support aptX low latency.

[Easy To Use] The Oasis supports full-featured voice guidance and status / codec indicators, making it incredibly easy to set up and use. Supports digital optical / AUX / RCA audio output standards making it compatible with 99% of the TVs on the market. Connect the Oasis in between your TV and soundbar - then use the convenient bypass switch to choose between your soundbar (bypass mode) and streamed audio (Bluetooth mode) without the need to plug / unplug any wires.

[Versatile Bluetooth Transmitter / Receiver] Bluetooth-enable virtually any of your audio devices at home. Use the Oasis as a transmitter to stream audio from your TV, or computer to a set of Bluetooth headphones. Or use the Oasis as a receiver and allow your home stereo or speakers to play streaming music from your cellphone or laptop.

[Support] If you have any questions, please send us an email. We have 10+ online video guides demonstrating how to use the Oasis with currently popular devices and 25+ FAQ in order to better support you. This product is fully-tested with certifications for FCC, CE, mic, RCM, aptX, BQB!
